dcterms:description: The U.S. Department of Energy DOE-417 Electric Emergency and Disturbance Report is a mandatory form for utilities to file emergency incidents for national security and emergency management responsibilities. It includes data such as date/time event began, date/time of restoration, area affected, NERC region, alert criteria, event type, demand loss, and number of customers affected.
dcterms:title: U.S. Department of Energy DOE-417 Electric Emergency and Disturbance Report

dcterms:creator: M. Papic
S. Ekisheva
J. Robinson
B. Cummings
dcterms:description: The North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) Transmission Availability Data System (TADS) provides data on the availability of transmission systems and is used to analyze the impact of overlapping outages on transmission grid resilience.
dcterms:title: North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) Transmission Availability Data System (TADS)

dcterms:description: The North American Energy Resilience Model is a dataset that provides insights into the resilience of the North American energy system, focusing on various factors affecting energy resilience.
dcterms:title: North American Energy Resilience Model
